definition: (bound form) crass/stupid/rude/(used to represent the sounds of "ru", "lu" etc in loanwords)
surname Lu/Lu, ancient state of China 魯國|鲁国[Lu3 guo2]/Lu, short name for Shandong 山東|山东[Shan1 dong1]
(onom.) the sound of a rolling object
Bengkulu (Indonesian town on the south coast of Sumatra)
Bengkulu (Indonesian town on the south coast of Sumatra)

sentences.english: What if the teacher or guru is as lost as oneself?
sentences.chinese: 如果教师或古鲁也和你一样地丢失了自己呢？

sentences.english: This is the unconscious dance of the guru.
sentences.chinese: 这就是古鲁的无意识之舞。

sentences.english: So there can be no fear if the guru's grace descends on one .
sentences.chinese: 因此，如果古鲁的恩典降临于你，就无需要害怕。

sentences.english: And they cannot be unfastened without the help of a guru.
sentences.chinese: 没有古鲁的帮助，他们不能把它们解开。

sentences.english: You have cleverly rationalized what the gurus and holy books have taught you.
sentences.chinese: 你很聪明地把古鲁或者圣典上所教导的东西合理化了。

sentences.english: This is how the dance of the guru and devotee emerged in the human expression.
sentences.chinese: 这就是暴露在人类语法中的古鲁和信徒之舞。

sentences.english: "Why is it, " he asked, "that you are against gurus?
sentences.chinese: “你反对古鲁，”他问，“这是为什么？

sentences.english: Equality and the dance of the savior or guru are at odds with one another.
sentences.chinese: 平等，是与救世主或古鲁的舞蹈彼此冲突的。

definition: woman who looks after small children/(old) female tutor
Dêgê county (Tibetan: sde dge rdzong) in Garze Tibetan autonomous prefecture 甘孜藏族自治州[Gan1 zi1 Zang4 zu2 zi4 zhi4 zhou1], Sichuan (formerly in Kham province of Tibet)
Acre, city in Israel, also known as Akko
Ur (Sumerian city c. 4500 BC in modern Iraq)
Pali, language of Theravad Pali canon/Barry (name)/Gareth Barry (1981-), English footballer
